title: Label release liners containing PCR content and unbleached fibres revealed by Ahlstrom - Packaging Europe
summary: Ahlstrom is expanding its Acti-V range of eco-friendly release liners made from recycled and unbleached fiber, designed for Pressure Sensitive Adhesive laminates and labels. The new products aim to reduce waste and energy consumption, with Acti-V RF Yellow containing at least 15% post-consumer recycled fiber and Acti-V RF Natural offering a 15% lower carbon footprint. Additionally, other companies like UPM Raflatac and Fedrigoni are also pursuing sustainable practices by recycling materials into new products.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses innovations that reduce environmental impact by incorporating recycled materials and minimizing energy consumption in the production of release liners.
business_innovation: TRUE - The introduction of new products that significantly differ from previous offerings and are available in the market qualifies as business innovation.
green_product: TRUE - The release liners, particularly Acti-V RF Yellow and Acti-V RF Natural, are designed to reduce environmental impact and are made from recycled fibers, fitting the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE - The manufacturing processes described aim to minimize energy consumption and waste, aligning with the definition of a green process.
product_or_process: Acti-V RF Yellow, Acti-V RF Natural
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 322230 - Stationery Product Manufacturing, 324121 - Asphalt Paving Mixture and Block Manufacturing, 322220 - Paper Bag and Coated and Treated Paper Manufacturing, 332322 - Sheet Metal Work Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE - The article provides substantiated claims about Ahlstrom's use of recycled materials and reductions in energy consumption, indicating that it is not an instance of greenwashing.

title: Labelexpo Europe 2023 technology preview: A-Z - Labels and Labeling
summary: The article discusses various companies showcasing innovations in the label and packaging industry at an event, emphasizing advancements in sustainability, efficiency, and technology. These innovations include new eco-friendly materials, automated processes, and improved production methods that reduce waste and energy consumption. The focus is on how these products and processes contribute to environmental sustainability while enhancing production quality and efficiency.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the innovations presented include products and processes that minimize environmental impact, promote sustainability, and utilize eco-friendly materials, aligning with the goals of reducing resource consumption and fostering a circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the companies introduce new or significantly improved products and processes that differ from their previous offerings, demonstrating a clear market introduction of innovative solutions.
green_product: TRUE, because the products mentioned are designed to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycle and are made from sustainable and recycled materials.
green_process: TRUE, because the processes described aim to conserve natural resources, decrease energy consumption, and minimize waste, all of which promote environmental sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: [323110 - Printing, 322223 - Specialized Design Services, 323120 - Support Activities for Printing, 334614 - Software and Other Prerecorded Compact Disc, Tape, and Record Reproducing]
greenwashing: FALSE, as the article presents genuine innovations focused on sustainability and improvements in production processes, rather than misleading or exaggerated claims about environmental benefits.
